title: I don't understand why Kassadin was nerfed and Leblanc is left as is
body: They both do something very similar. They both jump in and burst you and then jump back out before you have time to react. This combo is repeated until you're dead. You always preach about meaningful counterplay, so please tell me, what is the "meaningful counterplay" to Leblanc? You never catch her because of her safety, and it's impossible to chase her because she'll just stun you. And it's not just leblanc by the way. All assassins have saftey built into their kits, whether it's stealth or some other kind of gap closer. And they all hyperscale. The assassin meta is alive and well. And Kassadin wasn't part of it. Yes he had safety like assassins, but he didn't have the burst that Leblanc, Katarina, Rengar, Talon, etc have.

Meanwhile, Leblanc is kind of like Kassadin but on steroids. She has two Kass ults that don't stack in mana, that you can use without waiting 5 years for it's cost to lower. And you can cancel both of them within a ridiculously long window of time. And she gets a Shaco ultimate whenever she's low on health. And she has a snare because she needed cc I guess.

I muuuuuuuuch preferred kassadin to leblanc. Atleast once kassadin jumped in there was a window where you could punish him. With Leblanc she's 100% safe. Its super frustrating even if you know she's gonna go for the burst. 

league just needs to add more animation to things. All these instant unreactable teleports into burst damage are fucking annoying. Zed IMO has healthy teleports because they're telegraphed and you have time to react. On the other hand, LB / Kat / Talon literally are just on you instantly with no animation. Although not related to mobility, annie's stun is the same way. 

TL;DR, add more reaction time / animation to things and people won't bitch about ridiculous burst when they can actually avoid it. Not being within a huge radius of a character to not get hit is not counter play. That's just bad design.

Now she sees LCS pick and is spammed in solo queue. I can barely play my favorite champion now bc every just bitches and bitches
about her being OP. 

Anyways, I've played her a lot (i'm only mid gold, but i don't play ranked much), but here are some tips for you whiners playing against her:

1) shove her into her turret early, before she gets 3+ points in W. To hit her mid game power spike, it is important to quickly get her first 2  items (some CDR and AP). Yet, her early farming and AA is quite poor, exploit this. Force her to use her W to farm and waste her mana. Delay or weaken her mid-game (when she is arguably at her strongest) by hurting her early farm. This opportunity really only exists through levels 1-4 or so, so don't miss it.

2) Following 1): do not let her push. If you don't want to push to make yourself vulnerable, then fine, but don't let her push...if she does then she has the ability to become a huge lane bully and turret dive with little retaliation potential on her enemy's part. If you keep the waves balanced, or better - yours pushed, she won't really be able to push without using W, which is costly early and leaves her vulnerable without her escape. 

3) Remember, Leblanc is one of the strongest if not THE strongest lvl 6 champion. Respect the lvl 6. I stress this much more if she has flash + ignite available. 

4) She is a burst mage or assassin. She quickly uses all her abilities and then is all but useless while waiting for cool downs. Play carefully until she uses her combo. Wait for it, attempt to juke her E, and immediately engage her / the team after her combo is down.

5) she has huge kill potential and engage-range while Flash + ignite is available. Keep your distance. Force her to waste W as a gap closer, and prepare to juke E. 

6) Landing E makes for a skilled Leblanc-everthing is about landing that E. You know when it's coming...obviously when she Q's you or dashes in your face. Remember, keep your distance and prepare to juke the E. 

7) Ping her MIA & follow her roams. 

I know some of this is obvious, but I hope it helps someone.

I don't understand this argument. People seem to like to talk about Kass before the nerfs as if he was complete trash on the level of Urgot. He wasn't. He was a top competitive pick who was at least a top 5 pick/ban in every major region.

Were his nerfs overkill? I'd say yes. 
Was he "not part of the assassin meta"? Hell no, he was one of the top two assassins in the meta alongside Leblanc, at least competitively speaking.

He had powerful decision making skills built into his kit to take advantage of opponent stupidity; not titanic strength. I've proposed a rework to kassadin restoring his silence in exchange for scaling and base damages but I won't advertise that here. The point is his kit is in a state where riot can't alter anything without destroying his ability to exist as a viable champion.
